intro: Hartogia nigromontana, commonly known as the black mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Hartogia nigromontana is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in coastal and mountainous habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
